name: The Best Player Quiz / Test | Video Games | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who is the rookie with the highest overall rating in the "NBA Live 2005"?
questions.explanation:
Emeka Okafor.

	Emeka Okafor is the best rookie, with an overall rating of 70 of a possible 99. Dwight Howard scored 69, and Ben Gordon scored 66. Pavel Podkolzin has a 46.

questions.text: Who is the best dunker in the "NBA Live 2005"?
questions.explanation:
Jason Richardson.

	Jason Richardson outdoes all with a dunk rating of 99, which is the maximum possible. LeBron James is the second best with 98. Tracy McGrady has a rating of 96, and Vince Carter has a rating of 97. Other good dunkers are Kobe Bryant (95), and Desmond Mason (95).

questions.text: Who is the shortest player in the "NBA Live 2005"
questions.explanation:
Earl Boykins.

	Earl Boykins is the shortest player, standing at 5'5. Brevin Knight and Chucky Atkins are also some of the shortest players. Yao Ming was a joke. He is the tallest player, standing at 7'6. Earl Boykins' short height, however, comes in handy, because he has a speed and quickness of 99. Brevin Knight has the highest Steal rating with 97.

questions.text: Who is the most expensive player in the "NBA Live 2005"?
questions.explanation:
Shaquille O'Neal.

	Shaquille O'Neal is the moneymaker of the "NBA Live 2005", costing almost $30 million. Kevin Garnett is at 16 million, and Ray Allen and Kobe Bryant are at 15 million apiece.

questions.text: Who is the best passer in the "NBA Live 2005"?
questions.explanation:
Steve Nash.

	Steve Nash sure can pass the ball. He has a passing rate of 97; the highest in the "NBA Live 2005". He is one of the best Point Guards.

questions.text: Who is the Point Guard with the highest overall rating?
questions.explanation:
Baron Davis.

	Baron Davis is the best, with an overall rating of 88. The other three have an overall rating of 85. Other good point guards include Tony Parker (75), Chauncey Billups (71), and Steve Nash (75).

questions.text: Who is the Shooting Guard with the highest overall rating?
questions.explanation:
Kobe Bryant.

	Kobe Bryant is excellent in this version, with an overall rating of 94. Tracy McGrady had a 90, Ray Allen had an 85, and Paul Pierce an 89. Other good Shooting Guards include Jason Richardson (78), LeBron James (84), and Michael Finley (81).

questions.text: Who is the Center with the highest overall rating?
questions.explanation:
Shaquille O'Neal.

	Shaquille O'Neal has an overall rating of 92, and he is the best at Field Goals and Strength. Yao Ming has an overall rating of 80, and he is the tallest player. Ben Wallace has an overall rating of 77, and he is the best defensive player. Jahidi White has a timid overall of 55, though he is the best offensive rebounder.

questions.text: Who is the Power Forward with the highest overall rating?
questions.explanation:
Kevin Garnett.

	Kevin Garnett is the best player in the "NBA Live 2005", with an overall rating of 98. He is also the best defensive rebounder. Jermaine O'Neal has an overall rating of 85. Tim Duncan has an overall rating of 91, but he is the highest inside scorer. Rasheed Wallace has an overall of 81. Other strong power forwards include Dirk Nowitzki (85), Emeka Okafor (70), and Dwight Howard (69).

questions.text: Who is the Small Forward with the Highest Overall rating?
questions.explanation:
Vince Carter.

	Vince Carter, who happens to be my favorite player, is the best Small Forward, with an overall rating of 88. He is also the best jumper, and the player with the highest stamina. Peja Stojakovic has an overall rating of 81, but he has the best 3-Point and Free Throw ratings. Carmelo Anthony has an overall attribute of 80, making him the second best sophomore after LeBron James. Lamar Odom has an overall attribute of 73. I hope you enjoyed my quiz!  I LOVE THIS GAME! :P
